benchmark_details.name: TuringQ
benchmark_details.overview: TuringQ is designed to evaluate the reasoning capabilities of large language models (LLMs) in the theory of computation, consisting of 4,006 undergraduate and graduate-level question-answer pairs categorized into four difficulty levels and covering seven core theoretical areas.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a benchmark for assessing LLMs' understanding of computational theory and driving advancements in enhancing their skills.

data.source: Publicly available exam sets and homework solutions from universities worldwide, validated by domain experts.

methodology.calculation: Binary accuracy is calculated as the percentage of valid responses classified as 'valid' (scores 3-4).
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate superior quality, with binary accuracy representing the proportion of valid responses.
methodology.validation: Majority voting among human evaluators for final scoring.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All questions sourced from publicly available materials with proper attribution.
